instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01326: What is 820-01326? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP1V8_SLPS2R: What is PP1V8_SLPS2R? PP1V8_SLPS2R is a 1.8v power rail present when the system is in a SLPS2R state. .
definitions.PP3V3_G3H_RTC: What is PP3V3_G3H_RTC? PP3V3_G3H_RTC Is one of the first rails that has to come on in order for the USB-C mux chip to be powered in the T2 chip Macbook Pros..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01326</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: PBUS issues
threads.message:
Hello!

A new contender. 5v and ~30mA on the charger. PBUS is pulsing regularly at about 1hz. Sounds like a short somewhere? <SIGNAL>PP1V8_SLPS2R</SIGNAL> is trying to turn on but failing (only going up to about 0.1V it looks like). The rail is about 2ohms to ground. Is this too low? Injected a bit of current but T2 is the only thing that got warm.

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H_T</SIGNAL> is 3.3V and so is <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H_RTC</SIGNAL>.

History: 2 probe points at T2 ROM were ripped off the board (<SIGNAL>SOCROM_CLK</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>SOCROM_MOSI</SIGNAL>). Soldered 2 wires for them directly to the resistors at T2.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01326</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: PBUS issues
threads.message: More info: Diode reading of <SIGNAL>PP1V8_SLPS2R</SIGNAL> is 0.010v or less. But it jumps around a bit. That's unfortunate because only T2 got warm when I injected current. Maybe some crud under it? I hate this T2 bs.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01326</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: PBUS issues
threads.message:
Such low value is not good; very likely bad T2.
Nothing to lose heating it with quality flux; just try to burn eventually accumulated crap.
